skill.name: skill-from-masters
skill.description: Help users create high-quality skills by discovering and incorporating proven methodologies from domain experts. Use this skill BEFORE skill-creator when users want to create a new skill - it enhances skill-creator by first identifying expert frameworks and best practices to incorporate. Triggers on requests like "help me create a skill for X" or "I want to make a skill that does Y". This skill guides methodology selection, then hands off to skill-creator for the actual skill generation.

security_audit.summary: All 45 static findings are FALSE POSITIVES. The skill is pure documentation with no executable code. Pattern detections (Weak Cryptographic Algorithm, System Reconnaissance, C2 Keywords) are triggered by author names in the methodology database (e.g., Schwartz, Ousterhout) and documentation language about web search. No data exfiltration, code execution, or malicious behavior exists.

content.value_statement: Creating skills from scratch often misses proven frameworks. This skill helps discover expert methodologies so your skills embody the wisdom of recognized masters. It guides you through identifying, validating, and applying expert frameworks before generating any skill.
actual_capabilities: Consults local methodology database with 100+ expert frameworks across 10 domains
Searches web for expert sources and golden examples of excellence
Guides collaborative methodology selection with users
Extracts actionable principles from primary sources
Cross-validates insights across multiple expert sources
Hands off to skill-creator for final skill generation
limitations: Does not generate final skills directly (requires skill-creator)
Cannot access proprietary or paid expert content
Quality depends on web search results availability

use_cases.title: Build expert-backed skills
use_cases.description: Create skills grounded in proven methodologies from recognized masters in any domain.

use_cases.title: Codify expert knowledge
use_cases.description: Transform your domain expertise into reusable AI skills using established frameworks.

use_cases.title: Structure content frameworks
use_cases.description: Apply expert frameworks like Pyramid Principle or Design Sprint to create structured skills.

prompt_templates.title: Start skill creation
prompt_templates.prompt: I want to create a skill for [specific task]. Help me discover expert methodologies I can use to ground it in proven frameworks.

prompt_templates.title: Compare frameworks
prompt_templates.prompt: Compare the [framework A] and [framework B] methodologies for my [use case] skill. What are the key differences and when does each work best?

prompt_templates.title: Find golden examples
prompt_templates.prompt: Find the best examples of [output type] from top companies like Amazon, Intercom, or Google. What makes them exemplary?

prompt_templates.title: Extract principles
prompt_templates.prompt: Distill the core principles and implementation steps from [expert name]'s methodology on [topic]. How would I apply this to create a skill?

output_examples.input: I want to create a skill for writing product requirement documents
output: Expert frameworks found: Marty Cagan (problem-first PRDs), Barbara Minto (Pyramid Principle), Amazon (6-pager narrative)
Golden examples: Intercom PRD template, Linear spec format, Amazon working backwards
Common pitfalls: jumping to solutions before defining problem, writing for engineers instead of alignment, missing success metrics
Recommended approach: Start with problem space using Cagan, then solution space using Amazon's working backwards format

output_examples.input: Help me create a code review skill for my engineering team
output: Expert frameworks identified: Martin Fowler (refactoring), Robert Martin (clean code), Kent Beck (TDD), Kim Scott (radical candor)
Quality benchmarks: Google's code review guidelines, successful PR examples from open source projects
Core principles extracted: Behavior-preserving transformations, single responsibility, red-green-refactor cycle, caring personally while challenging directly
Skill structure: Context setting, checklist-based review, feedback delivery using radical candor, automated checks for clean code principles

output_examples.input: I need to design a sales outreach skill
output: Methodologies found: Neil Rackham (SPIN Selling), Matthew Dixon (Challenger Sale), Eugene Schwartz (5 Levels of Awareness)
Golden examples: Top performing sales templates from Gong analysis, winning outreach from high-performing sales teams
Skill design: Teach-tailor-take control approach, awareness level detection, problem-implication-question framework
Anti-patterns to include: Generic pitches, features-over-benefits, ignoring buyer awareness stage

best_practices: Start with the local database then search for additional expert sources
Always find primary sources, not just summaries or secondhand accounts
Cross-validate insights across multiple experts before selecting a framework
anti_patterns: Using vague or generic instructions instead of expert-derived principles
Skipping web search and relying only on the local database
Selecting a framework without finding concrete examples of excellence

faq.question: Which AI tools work with this skill?
faq.answer: Compatible with Claude, Codex, and Claude Code through standard prompt triggers.

faq.question: How many methodologies are in the database?
faq.answer: Over 100 expert frameworks across 10 domains including writing, product, sales, and leadership.

faq.question: Does this skill store user data?
faq.answer: No. This skill only reads from the local database and makes temporary web search queries.

faq.question: Can I combine multiple methodologies?
faq.answer: Yes. The workflow explicitly supports selecting 1-3 complementary methodologies and synthesizing them.

faq.question: What happens after I select a methodology?
faq.answer: The skill extracts actionable principles then hands off to skill-creator for actual skill generation.

faq.question: How is this different from skill-creator?
faq.answer: Skill-creator generates skills from prompts. This skill finds expert methodologies first to enhance skill-creator.
